Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge correctly applied the residency requirement under s. 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant spent significant time abroad and lacked clear evidence of maintaining a Canadian residence
Decision_Outcome: Citizenship application denied due to failure to meet residency requirements
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Citizenship Judge's decision
Court_Ruling: Decision was unreasonable due to unclear reasoning and unresolved ambiguities
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship Judge relied on 'information on file' without clarifying reasoning
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to meet 1,095-day physical presence requirement; inadequate justification by decision maker
Legal_Standard: Applicants must accumulate at least 1,095 days of residence in Canada within four years preceding application
Assessment_Factor: Physical presence in Canada, maintenance of residence, credibility of supporting evidence
Procedural_Issue: Lack of adequate reasons provided by the Citizenship Judge
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's evidence of residency deemed insufficient or unclear
Evidence_Used: Notes from file, unspecified documentation regarding time spent in and outside Canada
Application_Basis: Accumulation of 1,095 days of physical presence in Canada
Evidence_Assessed: Ambiguous notes and lack of concrete proof of Canadian residence
Relief_Sought: Set aside of the decision and remittal for reconsideration
Governing_Rule: Federal Court jurisprudence allows exceptions for special circumstances
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Unclear records and lack of detailed explanation from applicant
Outcome: Decision set aside; case remanded to a new Citizenship Judge for reconsideration
Harm_Assessment: Unfair denial of citizenship due to procedural deficiencies
Cause_Description: Applicant's citizenship application was denied for failing to meet residency requirements
Evidence_Handling: Insufficient clarification of ambiguous information on file
Evidence_Issues: Lack of transparency and clarity in evidentiary basis for decision
Residency_Compliance: Not met – insufficient documented presence in Canada
Evidence_Assessment: Inadequate evaluation of applicant’s residency claims
Decision_Rationale: Unreasonable decision due to failure to resolve factual ambiguities and provide clear reasoning
Evidentiary_Issues: Reliance on unclear 'information on file' without proper explanation
